best_practices: Use standalone components exclusively and avoid NgModules when possible
Prefer signals and signal forms over legacy two-way binding patterns
Keep component styles alongside their respective component files
anti_patterns: Avoid using deprecated NgModule patterns when standalone alternatives exist
Do not mix legacy two-way binding with signals unnecessarily
Avoid global style scattering - keep page styles with their components

faq.question: Which Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports Angular 21 and newer versions with full signal and standalone component support.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and conventions only. It does not generate or modify files directly.

faq.question: Does this skill run tests or builds?
faq.answer: No. The skill does not execute any build commands, tests, or external tooling operations.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing Perigon code?
faq.answer: Follow the directory structure and import patterns described in the skill. Match existing conventions in src/ClientApp/WebApp.

faq.question: What if my project uses different naming conventions?
faq.answer: The skill provides Perigon-specific standards. Adapt the principles to match your project requirements where needed.

faq.question: How does this compare to general Angular guides?
faq.answer: This skill provides Perigon-specific project structure, tooling preferences, and team conventions rather than general Angular documentation.
